meanings.definition: Queys (noun): plural form of quey, a young cow
meanings.sent1: The farmer's field was filled with playful queys.
meanings.sent2: The queys grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The queys decided to have a dance party in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The queys were like a group of curious children exploring the world.
meanings.sent5: The queys' spotted coats made them easy to spot in the green pasture.

meanings.definition: Queys (verb): third person singular present of quey, to give birth to a calf
meanings.sent1: The cow queys in the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: She queys with ease, bringing new life to the farm.
meanings.sent3: The cow queys while the rooster crows loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to quey is a miracle of nature.
meanings.sent5: The farm is filled with excitement when a cow queys.
